intro: Cyclophorus serpens, commonly known as the serpentine cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
